articles.title: Congratulations to Bangladeshi PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Bangladeshi PM
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Sheikh Hasina upon her assumption of office as prime minister of Bangladesh on Jan. 16.
					 The message expressed belief that the good bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger, wishing her greater success in her work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Gambian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Gambian Foreign Minister
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Aboubacar Abudoullah Senghore upon his appointment as Gambian foreign minister on Jan. 17.
					 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Spanish King Hopes for Development of Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Spanish King Hopes for Development of Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK 
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Juan Carlos I, king of Spain, received credentials from Kim Hyok Chol, DPRK ambassador to Spain, on January 15. 
					 The king hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop, wishing the DPRK government and people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: WFTU Supports S. Korean People's Anti-"government" Struggle
articles.content:
WFTU Supports S. Korean People's Anti-"government" Struggle
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The World Federation of Trade Unions (WFTU) recently sent a letter to the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) in support of their anti-"government" struggle.
					 The letter said:
					
					 The WFTU expresses solidarity with the KCTU and railway workers in their struggle in the name of its 86 million members in 126 countries.
					
					 We bitterly denounce the barbarous and undemocratic moves of the south Korean authorities who violated the democratic right of trade unions and made the police storm the headquarters of the KCTU and walk away its leading members and workers.
					
					 We will always stand by railway workers in their just struggle against railway privatization, lay-off and threats.
					
					 We will express support to the struggle of the KCTU and organizations under it against railway privatization and join the workers and people of south Korea in their struggle.

articles.title: Japan Slammed for Denying Past Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japan Slammed for Denying Past Sexual Slavery
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps in south Korea in a commentary on Jan. 16 warned the Japanese government turning away its eyes from the sexual slavery committed by the Imperial Japanese Army.
					 Japanese politicians are letting loose a spate of reckless remarks increasing pain of the victims to the past sexual slavery, and presentation of the crimes related to sexual slavery is disappearing in history textbooks, the commentary charged.
					
					 The shameless act of Japan continuing to visit the Yasukuni Shrine which regards war criminals as the God is accused by the international community, it said.
					
					 To settle the issue of the sexual slavery committed by the Imperial Japanese Army is recognized as the task common to the international community, and voices critic of the Japanese government which has denied the crimes and blame for them are expanding into governments and parliaments of various countries of the world, it noted.
					
					 It warned the Japanese government continuing to turn away its eyes from the recommendation of the UN and other international bodies, resolutions of parliaments of different countries and the demand of all circles and civic organizations.
					
					 It urged the Japanese government to make an apology and reparation to the women who were taken away as sexual slaves and other victims to Japan's war of aggression and colonial rule.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Indian Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Indian Political Figure
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India expressed full support to the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un, when meeting the DPRK ambassador to India on January 9.
					 He said:
					
					 All the successes made by the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Korean people in building a thriving socialist nation last year are the fruition of the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 His New Year Address is a historic work indicating the tasks and ways for the Korean people to make bigger successes in their drive for building a thriving nation this year.
					
					 It is the fortune of the DPRK to hold him as the supreme leader of the party and the state in high esteem. Under his leadership the army and people of the DPRK are registering brilliant successes in the confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 The single-minded unity of the whole society is being consolidated and the ideal of the people translated into a reality in the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is, indeed, an outstanding and tested statesman, iron-willed commander and benevolent father of the people.
					
					 The Communist Party of India will extend invariable support to the WPK and the Korean people in their drive for building a thriving socialist nation and reunifying the country this year, too.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Favored by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Favored by Foreign Personages 
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- A briefing and roundtable-talks on the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un were held by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Indian Society for Juche Idea-Self-Reliance Studies and an Ethiopian company between January 5 and 11. 
					 The secretary general of the Indian Society for Juche Idea-Self-Reliance Studies expressed the belief that the Korean people would surely carry out the tasks set forth in the New Year Address under the outstanding and tested leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The chief designer of the Ethiopian company and other speakers said that the future of the DPRK is bright and rosy as it is led by Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Greater victory and glory are always in store for the Korean people led by him, they added.

articles.title: Advantageous Scial System in DPRK Praised by Russian Political Party
articles.content:
Advantageous Social System in DPRK Praised by Russian Political Party
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Communist Workers Party of Russia affiliated to the Communist Party of the Soviet Union posted an article titled "Social phenomena peculiar to the DPRK" on its website on January 9.
					 The article under the subtitles "People who don't know house prices", "Section doctor system", "No jobless people" and "Dignity of women" said: Foreigners admire Changjon Street in Pyongyang after touring it.
					
					 It is because the majority of citizens living there are ordinary people and they do not know about the house prices at all. On the contrary, they ask foreigners about the house prices in the West.
					
					 It is unimaginable in the West that an ordinary worker buys a deluxe flat like the one in Changjon Street.
					
					 The DPRK has long enforced the section doctor system.
					
					 Doctors in the DPRK are totally responsible to the health of the citizens they are in charge of.
					
					 An ordinance on enforcing the universal compulsory 12-year education was adopted at the 6th session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK in 2012.
					
					 What is important is that all these are free of charge.
					
					 There are no jobless people in the DPRK. There is neither a signboard of "employment agency" nor anyone who finds out a job through papers and websites. Moreover, there is no one wandering about streets.
					
					 Only voices calling for working harder for the country and prosperity of society are loudly heard in the DPRK and one can never hear voices condemning or cursing its social system.
					
					 This is because there are no such conditions to lash them into fury as doctor's fee, house prices and taxes in the DPRK.
					
					 The slogan of "Everything for the people and everything by relying on them!" has been applied in all fabrics of social life in the DPRK.
					
					 It is fundamentally different from the capitalist world where the jungle law prevails and money is everything

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Published in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Published in Brazil 
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The second volume of  Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution of "With the Century," reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung, was brought out by the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil on January 10.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Mexican Organizations in Their Bulletins
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Mexican Organizations in Their Bulletins
 Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The detailed gist of the New Year Address made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un was carried by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea in their bulletins on January 11 and 13.
